sentences.en: A severe , forbidding man whom all feared and respected.
sentences.cn: 祖父是全家所崇拜、敬畏的人,常常带着凛然不可侵犯的神气.

sentences.en: As a group they had a forbidding and rigid quality.
sentences.cn: 他们聚在一起,自有一股森然的峻厉之气.

sentences.en: Even now there stretches before us a long, forbidding road.
sentences.cn: 就是现在摆在我们面前的仍然是一条艰苦漫长的道路.

sentences.en: He had a rather forbidding, saturnine manner.
sentences.cn: 他的举止相当乖戾阴郁，令人望而生畏。

sentences.en: His face was forbidding, even hostile.
sentences.cn: 他面容冷峻，甚至可以说是带有敌意。

sentences.en: In the past, the region had been protected by its forbidding geography and the extremities of its climate.
sentences.cn: 过去，这个地区令人生畏的地理条件和极端的天气状况使它受到保护。

sentences.en: Parliament has passed an act forbidding the slaughter of animals for pleasure.
sentences.cn: 议会通过了一项禁止杀生取乐的法令.

sentences.en: The emperor issued an edict forbidding doing trade with foreigners.
sentences.cn: 皇帝颁布了一项不得和外国人做生意的敕令.

sentences.en: The motion of forbidding smoking in public place is adopted.
sentences.cn: 禁止在公众场合吸烟的提案被采纳.

sentences.en: The pose emphasized her handsome and forbidding face.
sentences.cn: 这个姿势突出了她俊俏而严峻的面孔.

sentences.en: The town council passed a law forbidding the distribution of handbills.
sentences.cn: 市议会通过法律,禁止散发传单.

sentences.en: There is a clause in the contract forbidding tenants to sublet.
sentences.cn: 合同中有一条款禁止承租人转租房屋。

sentences.en: There was something a little severe and forbidding about her face.
sentences.cn: 她脸上有种严肃、冷峻的表情。

sentences.en: They overturned in 1923 state wartime statutes forbidding the use of foreign languages in school.
sentences.cn: 1923年,他们推翻了禁止在学校中使用外语的一些州的战时法令.

sentences.en: They passed a law forbidding the distribution of handbills.
sentences.cn: 他们通过一条法令禁止散发传单.

sentences.en: This is a law forbidding the import.
sentences.cn: 这是一条禁止进口的法律.

words.tran_cn: 被禁止的；严禁的，禁用的

trans.tran_en: having a frightening or unfriendly appearance

trans.tran_cn: 禁止( forbid的现在分词 )，妨碍，阻碍，阻止
